categories.name: Basics
categories.description: Learn the core building blocks of JavaScript including variables, constants, data types, operators, and the basic rules of writing code.

cards.title: const
cards.description: Declare a constant variable that cannot be reassigned.
cards.syntax: const x = 1;

cards.title: let
cards.description: Declare a variable that can be reassigned.
cards.syntax: let x = 1;

cards.title: Primitive Data Types
cards.description: Store a single value in a variable.

content.title: String
content.description: A sequence of characters.

content.title: Number
content.description: Integer or a floating-point number.

content.title: Boolean
content.description: True or false value.

content.title: Null
content.description: Intentional absence of a value.

content.title: Undefined
content.description: A variable without a value.

content.title: Symbol
content.description: Unique identifier.

content.title: BigInt
content.description: Greater then what the number type handles.

cards.title: Reference Data Types
cards.description: Store a reference to the location where the data is.

content.title: Arrays
content.description: Data structure that holds multiple values.

content.title: Functions
content.description: Reusable pieces of code that perform tasks.

content.title: Objects
content.description: Comma seperated lists of key-value pairs.

cards.title: Arithmetic Operators
cards.description: Basic math operators.

content.title: Modulus
content.description: Get the division remainder.

content.title: Exponentiation
content.description: Return the result of the first value to the power of the second.

content.title: Increment
content.description: Add 1 to a value.

content.title: Decrement
content.description: Subtract 1 from a value.

content.title: Concatenetion
content.description: Put 2 or more strings together.

cards.title: Assignment Operators
cards.description: Do something to the value then assign it to a variable.

content.title: Value Assignment
content.description: Simply assigning a value to a variable.

content.title: Addition Assignment
content.description: Adds the amount on the right side.

content.title: Subtraction Assignment
content.description: Subtracts the amount on the right side.

content.title: Multiplication Assignment
content.description: Multiplies the amount on the right side.

content.title: Division Assignment
content.description: Divides the amount on the right side.

content.title: Modulo Assignment
content.description: Gets the raminder of the amount on the right side.

content.title: Exponentiation Assignment
content.description: Gets the exponent of the amount on the right side.

cards.title: Comparison Operators
cards.description: Used to compare values.

content.title: Equal To
content.description: Checks just the value.

content.title: Equal Value & Type
content.description: Checks the value and the type.

content.title: Not Equal To
content.description: Checks just the value.

content.title: Not Equal Value & Type
content.description: Checks the value and the type.

content.title: Greater Than
content.description: Check if the value is bigger.

content.title: Less Than
content.description: Check if the value is smaller.

content.title: Greater Than or Equal
content.description: Check if the value is bigger or the same.

content.title: Less Than or Equal
content.description: Check if the value is smaller or the same.

cards.title: Console
cards.description: Used to display errors and test code.

content.title: console.log();
content.description: Output a message to the console.

content.title: console.error();
content.description: Makes the text red.

content.title: console.warn();
content.description: Makes the text yellow.

cards.title: Shortcuts
cards.description: Used to type code quicker.

content.title: shift + up/down
content.description: Highlight lines of code up and down.

content.title: shift + right/left
content.description: Highlight code right and left.

content.title: ctrl + right/left
content.description: Move cursor to beginning/end of line.

content.title: ctrl + up/down
content.description: Move cursor to beginning/end of file.

content.title: alt + up/down
content.description: Move line up/down.

content.title: shift + alt + up/down
content.description: Copy line up/down.

content.title: ctrl + /
content.description: Comment out a line of code.

content.title: ctrl + shift + /
content.description: Comment out multiple lines of code.

content.title: ctrl + d
content.description: Select the next instance of the selected word.

content.title: ctrl + shift + l
content.description: Select all instances of the selected word.

content.title: ctrl + shift + f
content.description: Search for a string in the project.

content.title: ctrl + shift + o
content.description: Search for a file in the project.

cards.title: Comments
cards.description: Lines of code that won't run
cards.syntax: // Single line

categories.name: Arrays
categories.description: Store and organize multiple values in a single variable, with methods to search, sort, add, or remove items.

cards.title: Creating an Array
cards.description: Arrays are created inside variables.
cards.syntax: const arr = [1, 2, 3, 4];

cards.title: Access by Index
cards.description: Arrays are zero based.
cards.syntax: arr[0];

cards.title: Mixed Values
cards.description: Arrays can have any kinds of values.
cards.syntax: const mixed = [1, 'John', null, true];

cards.title: Nesting
cards.description: Arrays can be nested inside each other.

cards.title: Array Iteration
cards.description: Use loops or array methods to run code on each element.
cards.syntax: for (const item of arr) { console.log(item); };

cards.title: Array Methods
cards.description: Different methods to manipulate the arrays.

content.title: Static Vs Non Static
content.description: Static methods require the 'Array' keyword in front of it, non static methods are applied directly to the array

content.title: .length
content.description: A property that returns the length of the array.

content.title: .push()
content.description: Adds to the end of the array (Non Static).

content.title: .pop()
content.description: Removes the last item in the array (Non static).

content.title: .unshift()
content.description: Adds to the beginning of the array (Non static).

content.title: .shift()
content.description: Remove from the beginning of the array (Non static).

content.title: .reverse()
content.description: Exactly that (Non static).

content.title: .includes()
content.description: Returns true if the array has the passed value (Non static).

content.title: .indexOf()
content.description: Returns the index for the passed value (Non static).

content.title: .join()
content.description: Returns the elements as a string with a separator (Non static).

content.title: .slice()
content.description: Extracts a part of the array without affecting the original, end is not a part of sliced part (Non static).

content.title: .splice()
content.description: Directly modifies the array by adding, removing, and changing the elements (Non static).

content.title: .concat()
content.description: Combine with another array (Non static).

content.title: .flat()
content.description: Removes the brackets from nested arrays, 'Infinity' to remove from all levels (Non static).

content.title: .isArray()
content.description: Check if something is an array (Static).

content.title: .from()
content.description: Convert an array like object into an array (Static).

content.title: .of()
content.description: Create an array from a variable number of arguments (Static).

content.title: .forEach()
content.description: Used to apply code to each element in the array (Non static).

content.title: .filter()
content.description: Returns an array of items that meet the condition that is passed (Non static).

content.title: .map()
content.description: Returns an array that is the result of a function called on each element (Non static).

content.title: .reduce()
content.description: Reduces the array to a single value by running a function on each element (Non static).

content.title: .find()
content.description: Returns the first element that matches a condition (Non static).

content.title: .findIndex()
content.description: Returns the index of the first element that matches a condition (Non static).

content.title: .some()
content.description: Returns true if at least one element meets the condition (Non static).

content.title: .every()
content.description: Returns true if all elements meet the condition (Non static).

content.title: .sort()
content.description: Sorts the array in place, modifying the original (Non static).

content.title: .toString()
content.description: Converts the array into a comma-separated string (Non static).

content.title: .fill()
content.description: Fills all or part of the array with a static value (Non static).

content.title: .at()
content.description: Returns the element at the given index, supporting negative indexes (Non static).

content.title: .fromAsync()
content.description: Creates an array from an async source, like an async iterable (Static).

content.title: .toReversed()
content.description: Returns a reversed copy of the array without mutating the original (Non static, ES2023).

content.title: .toSorted()
content.description: Returns a sorted copy of the array without mutating the original (Non static, ES2023).

content.title: .toSpliced()
content.description: Returns a copy of the array with elements added or removed, without mutating the original (Non static, ES2023).

content.title: .copyWithin()
content.description: Copies a section of the array to another location within the same array (Mutates).

content.title: .entries()
content.description: Returns an iterator with key/value pairs for each index (Non static).

content.title: .keys()
content.description: Returns an iterator with the keys (indexes) of the array (Non static).

content.title: .values()
content.description: Returns an iterator with the values of the array (Non static).

content.title: .flatMap()
content.description: Maps each element and flattens the result one level (Non static).

cards.title: Spread
cards.description: Used to combine multiple arrays into a new one
cards.syntax: const newArr = [...numbers, ...names];

cards.title: Destructuring
cards.description: Extract values from arrays into separate variables.
cards.syntax: const [a, b] = arr;

categories.name: Objects
categories.description: Create collections of related data and functionality using key-value pairs, useful for modeling real-world entities.

cards.title: Creating an Object
cards.description: Objects store data in key-value pairs. Keys are also called properties.
cards.syntax: const person = { name: 'John', age: 30 };

cards.title: Accessing Properties
cards.description: Access with dot or bracket notation.
cards.syntax: person.age;

cards.title: Nested Objects
cards.description: Objects can contain other objects or arrays.
cards.syntax: const user = { name: 'Alice', address: { city: 'NY', zip: 10001 } };

cards.title: Adding & Modifying Properties
cards.description: Objects can be updated or expanded dynamically.
cards.syntax:
person.country = 'USA';
person.age = 31;

cards.title: Deleting Properties
cards.description: Remove properties using the delete keyword.
cards.syntax: delete person.age;

cards.title: Object Methods
cards.description: Different methods to manipulate the objects.

content.title: .keys()
content.description: Returns an array of the object's keys (Static).

content.title: .values()
content.description: Returns an array of the object's values (Static).

content.title: .entries()
content.description: Returns an array of key-value pairs (Static).

content.title: .assign()
content.description: Copies properties from one object to another (Static).

content.title: .freeze()
content.description: Prevents adding, removing, or changing properties (Static).

content.title: .seal()
content.description: Prevents adding or removing properties but allows changes to existing ones (Static).

content.title: .defineProperty()
content.description: Defines or modifies a property with control over enumerability, writability, or configurability (Static).

content.title: .hasOwn()
content.description: Checks if an object has a specific property (ES2022, Static).

content.title: .fromEntries()
content.description: Creates an object from an array of key-value pairs (Static).

content.title: .create()
content.description: Creates a new object using another object as its prototype (Static).

cards.title: Object Destructuring
cards.description: Extract specific properties into variables.
cards.syntax: const { name, age } = person;

cards.title: Renaming During Destructuring
cards.description: Rename properties while destructuring.
cards.syntax: const { name: fullName } = person;

cards.title: Default Values
cards.description: Set defaults if the property doesn't exist.
cards.syntax: const { country = 'Unknown' } = person;

cards.title: Spread Operator
cards.description: Copy or merge objects.
cards.syntax: const newPerson = { ...person, country: 'USA' };

cards.title: Rest Operator
cards.description: Group remaining properties into a new object.
cards.syntax: const { name, ...info } = person;

cards.title: this Keyword
cards.description: Refers to the object that owns the method.
cards.syntax: const user = { name: 'Alice', greet() { console.log(this.name); } };

cards.title: Getters and Setters
cards.description: Allow defining computed or controlled property access.
cards.syntax: const obj = { get area() { return this.x * this.y; } };

cards.title: Object References
cards.description: Objects are assigned by reference, not by value.

categories.name: Conditionals
categories.description: Control the flow of your programs with if/else and switch statements, allowing your code to react to different conditions.

cards.title: if Statement
cards.description: Executes a block of code if the condition is true.

cards.title: if...else Statement
cards.description: Adds an alternative block of code if the condition is false.

cards.title: else if Statement
cards.description: Checks multiple conditions in sequence.

cards.title: Ternary Operator
cards.description: A shorthand way to write simple if...else statements.
cards.syntax: const result = x > 10 ? 'Greater' : 'Not greater';

cards.title: Switch Statement
cards.description: Checks multiple possible values of an expression and runs the matching case.

cards.title: Logical Operators
cards.description: Used to combine or invert conditions.

content.title: && (AND)
content.description: True only if both conditions are true.

content.title: || (OR)
content.description: True if at least one condition is true.

content.title: ! (NOT)
content.description: Inverts the truth value of a condition.

cards.title: Nullish Coalescing Operator (??)
cards.description: Returns the right-hand value only if the left-hand is null or undefined.
cards.syntax: let name = userName ?? 'Guest';

cards.title: Optional Chaining (?.)
cards.description: Safely access deeply nested properties without throwing errors.
cards.syntax: console.log(user?.address?.city);

cards.title: Short-Circuit Evaluation
cards.description: Uses logical operators to set defaults or conditionally execute code.
cards.syntax:
user && console.log(user.name);
const name = user.name || 'Guest';

categories.name: Loops
categories.description: Loops repeatedly execute code as long as a condition is met, allowing automation and iteration through data structures like arrays or objects.

cards.title: for Loop
cards.description: Runs a block of code a specific number of times.

cards.title: while Loop
cards.description: Runs as long as the condition is true.

cards.title: do...while Loop
cards.description: Runs the block once before checking the condition.

cards.title: for...of Loop
cards.description: Iterates over values of iterable objects like arrays, strings, or maps.

cards.title: for...in Loop
cards.description: Iterates over the keys (property names) of an object.

cards.title: Loop Control Statements
cards.description: Used to control or alter loop execution.

content.title: break
content.description: Immediately exits the loop.

content.title: continue
content.description: Skips the current iteration and continues to the next.

cards.title: Nested Loops
cards.description: Loops inside other loops, often used for multi-dimensional data.

cards.title: Iterating Arrays with Loops
cards.description: Common looping patterns used with arrays.

content.title: Standard for Loop
content.syntax: for (let i = 0; i < arr.length; i++) console.log(arr[i]);

cards.title: Looping Over Strings
cards.description: Strings are iterable, allowing you to loop over each character.

cards.title: Infinite Loops (⚠️)
cards.description: Loops without a proper stopping condition can run forever and freeze the program.

categories.name: Functions
categories.description: Write reusable pieces of code that accept input, perform tasks, and return results, making programs more efficient.

cards.title: Creating a Function
cards.description: Functions are declared using the function keyword.

cards.title: Calling a Function
cards.description: Execute the code inside the function by calling its name followed by parentheses.
cards.syntax: greet();

cards.title: Parameters & Arguments
cards.description: Functions can accept values (parameters) that change their behavior.

cards.title: Return Statement
cards.description: Functions can return a value back to where they were called.

cards.title: Function Expressions
cards.description: Functions can be stored in variables.

cards.title: Arrow Functions
cards.description: A shorter syntax introduced in ES6. Often used for callbacks and concise functions.
cards.syntax:
const add = (a, b) => a + b;
const square = x => x * x;

cards.title: Anonymous Functions
cards.description: Functions without a name, often used as callbacks.

cards.title: Default Parameters
cards.description: Give parameters a default value if none is provided.

cards.title: Rest Parameters
cards.description: Collect multiple arguments into an array.

cards.title: Callback Functions
cards.description: A function passed as an argument to another function.

cards.title: Higher-Order Functions
cards.description: Functions that take other functions as arguments or return them.

cards.title: Immediately Invoked Function Expression (IIFE)
cards.description: Executes immediately after being defined. Useful for scoping.

cards.title: Function Methods
cards.description: Special methods and properties available on all function objects.

content.title: .call()
content.description: Calls a function with a specified 'this' value and individual arguments.

content.title: .apply()
content.description: Similar to call(), but arguments are passed as an array.

content.title: .bind()
content.description: Creates a new function with a permanently bound 'this' value.

content.title: .toString()
content.description: Returns the function's source code as a string.
content.syntax:
function add(a, b) { return a + b; }
console.log(add.toString());

content.title: .length
content.description: Property that returns the number of expected parameters.

content.title: .name
content.description: Property that returns the function's name.

content.title: .constructor
content.description: References the Function() constructor that created the function object.

content.title: Function() Constructor
content.description: Used to create functions dynamically from strings (rarely used in practice).
content.syntax:
const add = new Function('a', 'b', 'return a + b');
console.log(add(2,3));

cards.title: Function Scope
cards.description: Variables defined inside a function are only accessible within it.

cards.title: Hoisting
cards.description: Function declarations are hoisted to the top of their scope.

cards.title: this Keyword
cards.description: In regular functions, 'this' refers to the object that called it. In arrow functions, it refers to the outer scope.

cards.title: Constructor Functions
cards.description: Used to create multiple similar objects using 'new'.

categories.name: String
categories.description: Work with text using methods for searching, slicing, replacing, and formatting content.

cards.title: Creating Strings
cards.description: Strings can be created using single quotes, double quotes, or backticks (template literals).

cards.title: Accessing Characters
cards.description: Each character in a string has an index starting at 0.

cards.title: String Length
cards.description: Returns the number of characters in a string.
cards.syntax:
const word = 'Hello';
console.log(word.length);

cards.title: Changing Case
cards.description: Convert string characters to upper or lower case.

cards.title: Extracting Parts
cards.description: slice(), substring(), and substr() extract parts of a string.

cards.title: Searching Strings
cards.description: Find positions or check if substrings exist.

cards.title: Replacing Text
cards.description: Replace part of a string with something else.

cards.title: Splitting and Joining
cards.description: Split a string into an array or join array elements into a string.

cards.title: Trimming Spaces
cards.description: Remove whitespace from the beginning and/or end of a string.

cards.title: Template Literals
cards.description: Use backticks for multi-line strings and embedded expressions.

cards.title: String Methods
cards.description: Built-in methods used to manipulate, search, and analyze string data.

content.title: concat()
content.description: Joins two or more strings together and returns a new string.

content.title: repeat()
content.description: Returns a new string with the original repeated a given number of times.

content.title: charAt() and charCodeAt()
content.description: Returns the character or its Unicode code at a given index.

content.title: fromCharCode()
content.description: Converts Unicode values into characters.

content.title: includes()
content.description: Checks if a string contains a specified substring. Returns true or false.

content.title: startsWith() and endsWith()
content.description: Check if a string begins or ends with a specific substring.

content.title: indexOf() and lastIndexOf()
content.description: Return the position of the first or last occurrence of a substring.

content.title: replace() and replaceAll()
content.description: Replace one or all matches of a substring or regex pattern.
content.example: // 'I like dogs and cats' and 'I like dogs and dogs'

content.title: slice(), substring(), and substr()
content.description: Extract parts of a string using different rules for index handling.

content.title: split()
content.description: Splits a string into an array based on a separator.

content.title: trim(), trimStart(), trimEnd()
content.description: Remove whitespace from the beginning and/or end of a string.

content.title: padStart() and padEnd()
content.description: Add padding to the start or end of a string until it reaches a specified length.

content.title: toUpperCase() and toLowerCase()
content.description: Convert all characters to upper or lower case.

content.title: valueOf() and toString()
content.description: Return the primitive string value of a String object.

categories.name: Number
categories.description: Work with numeric values, perform calculations, format output, and check numerical properties.

cards.title: Creating Numbers
cards.description: Numbers can be created as literals or using the Number constructor.

cards.title: Numeric Types
cards.description: JavaScript has only one number type — double-precision 64-bit floating point — which includes both integers and decimals.
cards.syntax:
console.log(typeof 42);
console.log(typeof 3.14);

cards.title: Checking Type
cards.description: Use typeof or Number.isInteger() to check a value's numeric type.
cards.syntax:
console.log(typeof 5);
console.log(Number.isInteger(5));

cards.title: Converting to Numbers
cards.description: Convert other data types to numbers using Number(), parseInt(), or parseFloat().

cards.title: Special Numeric Values
cards.description: Infinity, -Infinity, and NaN represent special numeric constants.

cards.title: Number Properties
cards.description: Static constants that define numeric limits and special values.

cards.title: Number Methods
cards.description: Built-in methods used to test, format, and convert numeric data.

content.title: isFinite()
content.description: Checks if the given value is a finite number.

content.title: isInteger()
content.description: Checks if a value is an integer.

content.title: isNaN()
content.description: Checks if the given value is NaN (Not a Number).

content.title: isSafeInteger()
content.description: Checks if the given value is a safe integer (between MIN_SAFE_INTEGER and MAX_SAFE_INTEGER).

content.title: parseInt()
content.description: Parses a string and returns an integer. The second parameter (radix) specifies the number base.

content.title: parseFloat()
content.description: Parses a string and returns a floating-point number.

content.title: toFixed()
content.description: Formats a number using fixed-point notation with a specific number of decimals.

content.title: toExponential()
content.description: Returns a string representing the number in exponential (scientific) notation.

content.title: toPrecision()
content.description: Formats a number to a specified total number of digits.

content.title: toString()
content.description: Converts a number to a string, optionally using a different base (radix).

content.title: toLocaleString()
content.description: Returns a localized string representation of the number.

content.title: valueOf()
content.description: Returns the primitive numeric value of a Number object.

categories.name: Math
categories.description: Perform mathematical operations and access constants like π (Pi) and e using the Math object. All methods are static and called as Math.method().

cards.title: Math Overview
cards.description: The Math object provides mathematical constants and functions. It is not a constructor, so you cannot use 'new Math()'.
cards.syntax:
console.log(Math.PI);
console.log(Math.sqrt(16));

cards.title: Math Constants
cards.description: Predefined mathematical constants.
cards.syntax:
Math.E;        // Euler's number (~2.718)
Math.PI;       // Pi (~3.14159)
Math.SQRT2;    // √2 (~1.414)
Math.SQRT1_2;  // √1/2 (~0.707)
Math.LN2;      // Natural log of 2
Math.LN10;     // Natural log of 10
Math.LOG2E;    // Log base 2 of e
Math.LOG10E;   // Log base 10 of e
cards.example: // Use constants for precise math calculations

cards.title: Rounding Methods
cards.description: Round numbers up, down, or to the nearest integer.
cards.syntax:
Math.round(4.5);  // 5
Math.floor(4.9); // 4
Math.ceil(4.1);  // 5
Math.trunc(4.9); // 4

cards.title: Random Numbers
cards.description: Generate random numbers between 0 (inclusive) and 1 (exclusive), or use scaling for custom ranges.

cards.title: Absolute and Sign
cards.description: Get the absolute value or determine the sign of a number.
cards.syntax:
Math.abs(-10);  // 10
Math.sign(-5);  // -1
Math.sign(0);   // 0
Math.sign(7);   // 1

cards.title: Powers and Roots
cards.description: Work with squares, cubes, and arbitrary powers or roots.
cards.syntax:
Math.pow(2, 3);  // 8
Math.sqrt(9);   // 3
Math.cbrt(27);  // 3

cards.title: Min and Max
cards.description: Find the smallest or largest value from a list of numbers.

cards.title: Math Methods
cards.description: Built-in Math methods for calculations, rounding, logarithms, trigonometry, and randomization.

content.title: abs()
content.description: Returns the absolute (positive) value of a number.

content.title: sign()
content.description: Returns the sign of a number: -1, 0, or 1.

content.title: pow()
content.description: Raises a number to a specified power.

content.title: sqrt()
content.description: Returns the square root of a number.

content.title: cbrt()
content.description: Returns the cube root of a number.

content.title: round()
content.description: Rounds a number to the nearest integer.

content.title: floor()
content.description: Rounds a number down to the nearest integer.

content.title: ceil()
content.description: Rounds a number up to the nearest integer.

content.title: trunc()
content.description: Removes the decimal part of a number, keeping only the integer part.

content.title: min()
content.description: Returns the smallest value among given numbers.

content.title: max()
content.description: Returns the largest value among given numbers.

content.title: random()
content.description: Returns a random number between 0 (inclusive) and 1 (exclusive).

content.title: log()
content.description: Returns the natural logarithm (base e) of a number.

content.title: log10()
content.description: Returns the base 10 logarithm of a number.

content.title: log2()
content.description: Returns the base 2 logarithm of a number.

content.title: exp()
content.description: Returns e raised to the power of a number.

content.title: sin(), cos(), tan()
content.description: Return the trigonometric sine, cosine, or tangent of an angle (in radians).

content.title: asin(), acos(), atan()
content.description: Return the arcsine, arccosine, or arctangent of a number (in radians).

content.title: atan2()
content.description: Returns the angle in radians between the positive x-axis and the point (x, y).

content.title: hypot()
content.description: Returns the square root of the sum of squares of its arguments (Pythagorean theorem).

content.title: clz32()
content.description: Returns the number of leading zero bits in a 32-bit binary representation of a number.

content.title: imul()
content.description: Performs 32-bit integer multiplication (useful for bitwise operations).

content.title: fround()
content.description: Returns the nearest 32-bit single-precision float representation of a number.

categories.name: Date & Time
categories.description: Work with dates and times — create, format, compare, and extract components from Date objects.

cards.title: Creating Dates
cards.description: The Date object represents a specific point in time. It can be created in several ways.
cards.example:
new Date();                // current date & time
new Date('2025-10-19');     // specific date
new Date(2025, 9, 19, 14);  // Oct 19, 2025 14:00

categories.name: Regular Expressions (RegEx)
categories.description: Patterns used to match, search, and replace text in strings. Essential for validation, parsing, and text manipulation.

cards.title: What is a Regular Expression?
cards.description: A RegEx is a sequence of characters that defines a search pattern, mainly used for string matching.
cards.syntax:
const pattern = /abc/;
const pattern2 = new RegExp('abc');

cards.title: Basic Patterns
cards.description: Common symbols and their meaning.
cards.syntax:
.  => any character
\d => digit [0-9]
\w => word character [a-zA-Z0-9_]
\s => whitespace
^  => start of string
$  => end of string
[] => character set

cards.title: Quantifiers
cards.description: Specify how many times a character or group should appear.
cards.syntax:
* => 0 or more
+ => 1 or more
? => 0 or 1
{n} => exactly n
{n,} => n or more
{n,m} => between n and m

cards.title: Flags
cards.description: Modify the behavior of the pattern.
cards.syntax:
g => global match
i => case-insensitive
m => multi-line
s => dot matches newline
y => sticky

cards.title: RegEx Methods
cards.description: Use RegEx with strings or on the RegExp object.
cards.syntax:
const str = 'hello123';
str.match(/\d+/); // returns ['123']
str.replace(/\d+/, '456'); // 'hello456'
/\d+/.test(str); // true
/\d+/.exec(str); // ['123']
cards.example: // Search, match, replace, or test strings

cards.title: Anchors and Boundaries
cards.description: Define positions in the string rather than characters.
cards.syntax:
^abc => string starts with 'abc'
abc$ => string ends with 'abc'
\bword\b => matches 'word' as a whole word

cards.title: Groups and Capturing
cards.description: Use parentheses to group parts of a pattern and capture matches.

cards.description: Use the pipe | to match one pattern or another.
cards.syntax: /cat|dog/.test('dog');

cards.title: Lookahead and Lookbehind
cards.description: Advanced patterns to assert conditions without consuming characters.
cards.syntax:

const pattern2 = /(?<=\\$)\\d+/; // digits preceded by '$'
